org.schwering.evi.gui.main
Class TabBar

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JTabbedPane
                  org.schwering.evi.gui.main.TabBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, IModuleListener, IModuleLoaderListener, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class TabBar
extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane
implements IModuleListener, IModuleLoaderListener

The main tabbar of the application.

Though it is possible to add all kinds of java.awt.Components to the tabbar, one should add only IPanels. There are two kinds of IPanels: those that are instances of IModules and those that are not. Module instances are added and removed automaticall by a IModuleListener. All other kind IPanels should be added and removed via the methods addTab(IPanel) and remove(IPanel).

Version:
$Id: TabBar.java 43 2006-05-09 19:36:23Z schwering $
Author:
Christoph Schwering (mailto:schwering@gmail.com)

Method Detail

loaded

public void loaded(ModuleContainer loadedModule)
Description copied from interface: IModuleLoaderListener
Fired when a module is loaded. The module is already registered internally when this event is fired. This means it is found by the ModuleLoader.getLoaded* methods.

Specified by:
loaded in interface IModuleLoaderListener

unloaded

public void unloaded(ModuleContainer unloadedModule)
Description copied from interface: IModuleLoaderListener
Fired when a module is unloaded. The module is already unregistered internally when this event is fired. This means it is no longer found by the ModuleLoader.getLoaded* methods!

Specified by:
unloaded in interface IModuleLoaderListener
Parameters:
unloadedModule - The module which is unloaded.

instantiated

public void instantiated(IModule newInstance)
The event method fired when a module is instantiated. If the module which is instantiated is an an instance of IPanel, a respective tab is added.

Specified by:
instantiated in interface IModuleListener
Parameters:
newInstance - The newly created instance object.
See Also:

disposed

public void disposed(IModule disposedInstance)
The event method fired when a module is disposed. If the disposing module is an instance of IPanel, the respective tab is removed.

Specified by:
disposed in interface IModuleListener
Parameters:
disposedInstance - The instance object which disposing.
See Also:
ModuleFactory.disposeInstance(IModule)

addTab

public void addTab(IPanel panel)
Adds a panel.
Do not use this method to add module instances! New module instances are added automatically with a listener (instantiated(IModule)).

Parameters:
panel - The new panel.

remove

public void remove(IPanel panel)
Removes a panel.
Do not use this method to remove module instances! Module instances are removed automatically with a listener (instantiated(IModule)).

Parameters:
panel - The panel that should be removed.

setTitle

public void setTitle(IPanel panel,
                     java.lang.String title)
Updates the title of the module instance or any other IPanel.

Parameters:
panel - The module instance or any other IPanel in the tabbar.
title - The new title.

removeSelectedTab

public void removeSelectedTab()
Removes the selected panel from the tabbar.

See Also:
removeTabAt(int)

removeTabAt

public void removeTabAt(int index)
Removes a panel with this procedure:
  • If the component at the index is the panel of a module (e.g. if the corresponding object in the internal hashtable is instance of IModule), the module is disposed with ModuleFactory.disposeInstance. Then, the event disposed is thrown and this event method will remove the concrete component from the tabbar.
  • If the component at the index is the panel of an instance of IPanel, the instance is disposed via IPanel.dispose and the tab is removed immediately.
  • Otherwise, the component is simply removed immediately.

    • Parameters:
    index - The index of the panel on the tabbar.

hightlightTab

public void hightlightTab(java.awt.Component tab,
                          java.awt.Color color)
Sets the color of the tab of the given component.

Parameters:
tab - The component whose tabs should be changed.
color - The new color.
